newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Semiconductor March sales down 26.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Semiconductor March sales down 26.4 pct.

text.p: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd said on Wednesday its sales revenue in March fell 26.4 percent to T$2.797 billion from T$3.801 billion in March 1996, its all-time monthly high.
The chipmaker, however, said the sales figure reflected a 23 percent rise from February's T$2.274 billion.
For the first three months of 1997, Taiwan Semiconductor posted total sales of T$7.604 billion, down 26.3 percent from T$10.323 billion in the same period in 1996, the company said in a statement.
The company said the integrated circuit industry had experienced a general downturn for the past year and its own sales had declined for eight consecutive months after the March 1996 peak.
The decline has now been reversed, it said.
The company has forecast 1997 sales at T$35.22 billion.
